titleStmt.title: Psalterium Carolinum the devotions of His Sacred Majesty Charles the First in his solitudes and sufferings / rendred in verse by T.S., Esq. ; and set to musick for three voices, an organ or theorbo, by John Wilson, Dr. in musick, professor in Oxford.
titleStmt.author: Stanley, Thomas, 1625-1678.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A61293 of text R38273 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing S5243B). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

notesStmt.note: Verse adaptation of the Eikōn basilikē.
Includes frontispiece portrait of Charles I by William Faithorne the elder.
Reproduction of original in the Cambridge University Library.
